lines: 世界初のコンピュータ
世界初のコンピュータ

lines.captiontext: The <tips,16,first ever computer> was built during World War Two.
The <tips,16,first ever computer> was built during World War Two.
Predicting ballistic trajectories required myriad calculations...
Predicting ballistic trajectories required myriad calculations...
...so it was created to process them as quickly and accurately as possible.
...so it was created to process them as quickly and accurately as possible.
You might even say that computers started out as devices for simulating events.
You might even say that computers started out as devices for simulating events.

lines: スーパーコンピュータ
スーパーコンピュータ

lines.captiontext: In the early 21st century, Japan created a <tips,18,supercomputer> simply named "<tips,17,Earth Simulator>."
In the early 21st century, Japan created a <tips,18,supercomputer> simply named "<tips,17,Earth Simulator>."
Explaining and predicting environmental changes on a global scale required far more processing power than ballistics calculations did.
Explaining and predicting environmental changes on a global scale required far more processing power than ballistics calculations did.
As such, it boasted some of the most advanced technologies available at that time.
As such, it boasted some of the most advanced technologies available at that time.
The completed supercomputer broke records, and received praise from around the globe.
The completed supercomputer broke records, and received praise from around the globe.
However, the original Earth Simulator's predictions were limited to only the Earth's atmosphere and sea currents.
However, the original Earth Simulator's predictions were limited to only the Earth's atmosphere and sea currents.
So, what, might I ask, would happen if someone were to create an Earth Simulator capable of predicting every event?
So, what, might I ask, would happen if someone were to create an Earth Simulator capable of predicting every event?
All laws of physics.
All laws of physics.
All natural phenomena.
All natural phenomena.
All activities exhibited by organisms.
All activities exhibited by organisms.
And all of humanity, along with the societies and cultures they've built.
And all of humanity, along with the societies and cultures they've built.
If we could simulate any and every event on Earth...
If we could simulate any and every event on Earth...
What would you make of the result?
What would you make of the result?

Then allow me to introduce to you\nthe completed...
Then allow me to introduce to you\nthe completed...
GAIA.
GAIA.
GAIA.
GAIA.
GAIA.
GAIA.

All natural phenomena.
All activities exhibited by organisms.
All activities exhibited by organisms.
And all of humanity, along with the societies and cultures they've built.
And all of humanity, along with the societies and cultures they've built.
It replicates every event.
It replicates every event.
Every single one of them.
Every single one of them.
